personalInfo.name: Edmund
personalInfo.title: Mechanical Engineering Student
personalInfo.longDescription: I am a Mechanical Engineering student bridging high-level academic theory with multidisciplinary technical execution across UC Berkeley and UCL. My background spans from mathematical modeling and mechatronics to aerospace recovery systems and sustainable building design. Whether optimizing thermal management for photon detectors in a research lab, designing award-winning structural pylons, or leading regional educational initiatives in Sarawak, I combine analytical rigor with a passion for innovation. My toolkit includes proficiency in MATLAB, Fusion 360, Revit, and BIM, underpinned by a consistent record of excellence, including a 4.00 GPA at Berkeley and the Frederic Barnes Waldron Best Student Award.

education.longDescription: I commenced my MEng Mechanical Engineering degree at University College London in September 2023. This programme has provided a rigorous foundation in engineering principles while equipping me with a multi-disciplinary skill set spanning from advanced computational coding to physical manufacturing. My academic journey has been defined by a commitment to excellence, resulting in several departmental and faculty-wide awards for ranking at the top of my cohort.

technicalProjects.title: FLOW Lab Research (UC Berkeley)
technicalProjects.longDescription: Designed a physical enclosure for a high-sensitivity ME3 Photon Detector array used for flow regime analysis. Developed a Raspberry Pi Pico W-based cooling controller with PWM pump regulation and a visual/auditory alarm system to prevent thermal damage. Fabricated a custom air generation module with a high-efficiency fan funnel and MEMS velocity sensor.

subProjects.title: Population Modelling
subProjects.description: Developed MATLAB models using Logistic and Malthusian equations to forecast global dynamics.

subProjects.title: Pandemic Simulation
subProjects.description: Simulated COVID-19 and H1N1 outbreaks using SIR compartmental models, quantified via Least Squares Regression and Euler's method.

subProjects.title: Structural Analysis
subProjects.description: Analyzed bridge resonance and damping by solving second-order ODEs and the wave equation using Fourier series and finite difference methods.

subProjects.title: Image Processing
subProjects.description: Engineered a MATLAB tool using Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) for high-fidelity data compression and edge detection.

technicalProjects.title: UCL Rocketry
technicalProjects.longDescription: Designed the ServoMag parachute ejection system, utilizing a servomotor and electromagnet for precise electronic actuation. Developed a dual-deployment recovery system with main and drogue parachutes, leading to a successful recovery and top-ranking at the Spaceport America Cup.

technicalProjects.title: UCL Engineering Challenges (23/24)
technicalProjects.longDescription: Engineered a 1kg balsa wood pylon using GSA Structural Analysis and truss theory. The design successfully sustained a record-breaking load of 235N during physical performance testing.

technicalProjects.title: UCL Mechathon
technicalProjects.longDescription: Collaborated in a five-member team to design and manufacture an elastic-band-powered aircraft within a 48-hour development cycle. Utilized Fusion 360 to model an aerodynamically optimized glider and employed laser cutting and 3D printing to achieve first runner-up status.

professionalAndLeadership.longDescription: Contributed to high-profile projects including a specialist research facility and two prominent London museums. Designed condensate routing for MVHR units using Dalux and conducted pressure duct calculations and sizing within BIM and Revit environments. Performed area scheduling and AHU service classification in Bluebeam Revu, and utilized Arup’s in-house tools for embodied carbon analysis of FCU servicing options.

Founded an initiative to bridge the educational resource gap for secondary students in Sarawak. Orchestrated flagship education roadshows across five cities—Kuching, Miri, Bintulu, Sibu, and Kota Samarahan—and managed scholarship talks attracting over 100 participants. Collaborated with entities such as Sarawak Energy Berhad and Yayasan Hasanah to deliver workshops and developed a centralized scholarship resource via Notion.

professionalAndLeadership.role: Sergeant, Band Major, and NCO Council Chairman
professionalAndLeadership.longDescription: Over a 12-year tenure, I directed weekly parade meetings involving drill, first aid, and camping activities. As Band Major, I led the percussion, woodwind, and brass sections for performances and oversaw the planning and execution of numerous leadership and musical camps.
